text:
*[Bug 18892] Support the use of netrc when using the libcurl downloader?*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18892>

--- Comment #13 from Eric Lindblad (<mailto:lindblad@gmx.com|lindblad@gmx.com>) ---
Apologies in advance for this enquiry.

`<https://dotsrc.org/mirrors/>`

I'm curious if R coders are for any purposes using rsync over TLS.

elements.text: [Bug 18892] Support the use of netrc when using the libcurl downloader?

text:
*[Bug 18917] New: length<- does not support expression vectors*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18917>

            Bug ID: 18917
           Summary: length<- does not support expression vectors
           Product: R
           Version: R-devel (trunk)
          Hardware: Other
                OS: Other
            Status: UNCONFIRMED
          Severity: normal
          Priority: P5
         Component: Language
          Assignee: <mailto:R-core@R-project.org|R-core@R-project.org>
          Reporter: <mailto:jaganmn@mcmaster.ca|jaganmn@mcmaster.ca>

help("length<-") states that `length<-` supports vector and pairlist arguments,
but at the moment it does not support expression vectors:

```
> x <- expression(.)
> length(x) <- 0L
Error in length(x) <- 0L : unimplemented type 'expression' in 'length<-'
```

The message is from `xlengthgets` in `builtin.c`, which is called in several
places, e.g., by `do_rep_len` in `seq.c` when repeating vectors of zero length
to nonzero length, hence:

```
> rep(expression(), length.out = 1L)
Error: unimplemented type 'expression' in 'length<-'
```

The patch is trivial:

```
Index: src/main/builtin.c
===================================================================
--- src/main/builtin.c  (revision 88405)
+++ src/main/builtin.c  (working copy)
@@ -904,6 +904,7 @@
        }
        break;
     case VECSXP:
+    case EXPRSXP:
        for (i = 0; i < len; i++)
            if (i < lenx) {
                SET_VECTOR_ELT(rval, i, VECTOR_ELT(x, i));
Index: tests/reg-tests-1e.R
===================================================================
--- tests/reg-tests-1e.R        (revision 88405)
+++ tests/reg-tests-1e.R        (working copy)
@@ -2021,7 +2021,15 @@
 ## had failed in R-devel around 2025-06-26 (and before R 4.3.0)


+## length(<expression>) <- value
+x <- expression(.)
+length(x) <- 0L
+stopifnot(identical(x, expression()),
+          identical(`length<-`(x, 2L), expression(NULL, NULL)))

+
+
+
 ## keep at end
 rbind(last =  proc.time() - .pt,
       total = proc.time())
```
